title: Easeout Weekly #31
body:
Frontend News aims to keep you updated with what's happening in the world of web dev! With the latest news and resources from the design & development community.
![Piggy Bank](/images/uploads/piggy-bank.jpg) [Enforcing performance budgets with webpack](https://css-tricks.com/enforcing-performance-budgets-with-webpack/) This article takes a look at you can configure how performance hints are shown and size thresholds through the *performance* object in your *webpack.config.js* file. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/enforcing-performance-budgets-with-webpack/)
![Comparing Styling Methods In Next.js Article Card](/images/uploads/comparison-styling-methods-next-js.png) [Comparing Styling Methods In Next.js](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/09/comparison-styling-methods-next-js/) With Next.js, one of the things you need to know is how to integrate different CSS methods with its API, and that is the focus of this tutorial. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/09/comparison-styling-methods-next-js/)
![Emoji Skin Tones](/images/uploads/emoji-skin-tones.jpeg) [Changing Emoji Skin Tones Programmatically](https://css-tricks.com/changing-emoji-skin-tones-programmatically/) In this article we're going to figure out how to work with emoji modifiers programmatically. This way, if you’re ever stuck without skin tone support — or want to create custom variations of other emoji — then you’ll know how! [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/changing-emoji-skin-tones-programmatically/)
![GraphQL Template](/images/uploads/modern-blog-post-graphql-gatsby.png) [Advanced GraphQL Usage In Gatsby Websites](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/09/advanced-graphql-usage-gatsby-websites/) In this article, Aleem Isiaka explains what GraphQL query constructs are, and how they can be used to interact with the data access layer of a Gatsby website. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/09/advanced-graphql-usage-gatsby-websites/)
![Cartoon Zombies](/images/uploads/60daysofzombies.png) [Lessons Learned from Sixty Days of Re-Animating Zombies with Hand-Coded CSS](https://css-tricks.com/lessons-learned-from-sixty-days-of-re-animating-zombies-with-hand-coded-css/) [](https://nuxtjs.org/)The title says it all! We’ll talk about practical stuff, but the examples pretty much all involve zombies and silly jokes. You have been warned. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/lessons-learned-from-sixty-days-of-re-animating-zombies-with-hand-coded-css/)
![GreenSock x React](/images/uploads/gsap-react.jpeg) [Animating React Components With GreenSock](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/09/animating-react-components-greensock/) In this article, Blessing explains how GSAP plays well with the React library by integrating its functions into a React component in building an example landing page with a variety of animations. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/09/animating-react-components-greensock/)
![Designing For Attention Article Card](/images/uploads/designing-for-attention.png) [Designing For Attention](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/09/designing-for-attention/) In this article, Victor Yocco covers specific tactics with supporting research that are bound to help you design for attention. He also discusses the need to understand why we want to gain users’ attention as well as what our users’ needs are. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/09/designing-for-attention/)
![Google Search Retro Page](/images/uploads/google-1997.png) [Web History: Search](https://css-tricks.com/chapter-4-search/) In this article, we see the fourth chapter of the web history series by Jay Hoffmann. And get a real dose of 90s web nostalgia! [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/chapter-4-search/)
![Interaction Example](/images/uploads/interaction-media.jpeg) [Interaction Media Features and Their Potential (for Incorrect Assumptions)](https://css-tricks.com/interaction-media-features-and-their-potential-for-incorrect-assumptions/) A deep dive into interaction media queries with Patrick H. Lauke. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/interaction-media-features-and-their-potential-for-incorrect-assumptions/)
![5 Awesome JavaScript Promise Tricks Article](/images/uploads/js-promise-tricks.png) [5 Awesome JavaScript Promise Tricks](https://davidwalsh.name/javascript-promise-tricks) The [Promise API](https://davidwalsh.name/promises) changed the game in JavaScript. We went from abusing *setTimeout*s and settling for synchronous operations to doing everything possible to leverage this new async API. Let's check out a handful of awesome Promise API tricks! [Read it ➡️](https://davidwalsh.name/javascript-promise-tricks)
![Shoptalk Logo](/images/uploads/shoptalk.png) [Smashing Conf Live Webinar](https://shoptalkshow.com/430/) Chris and Dave are coming to you live (recorded) from Smashing Conf's Live Webinar riffing on the talks and presentations, as well as their own Marketing Cloud Webinar Presentation. [Listen up ➡️](https://shoptalkshow.com/430/)
![Half visible face](/images/uploads/content-visibility.jpg) [content-visibility: the new CSS property that boosts your rendering performance](https://web.dev/content-visibility/) A neat article, showing how leveraging the `content-visibility` property greatly improves the initial user load & allows for faster interactions with on-screen content. [Read it ➡️](https://web.dev/content-visibility/)

short: A weekly roundup of the latest web design & development news.
